definitions.definition: An argumentative troublemaker or revolutionary; one who agitates against the current situation.
definitions.example: The member of the college's Communist League was a firebrand who would launch a sit-in or protest march at a moment's notice.

definitions.definition: A torch or other burning stick with a flame at one end.
definitions.example: The crowd cheered as a firebrand was tossed onto the huge pile of wood to start the traditional homecoming bonfire.
